questions.question_text:
You are a Dynamics 365 Customer Service administrator.
Users report performance issues with Dynamics 365.
You need to diagnose the performance issues. You run Dynamics 365 Diagnostics.
What should you review?

You need to simplify the registration process for repeat guests.
Which entity component should you use?

choices.B: Push the Dynamics 365 for Outlook to childcare workers.
choices.A: Have the childcare worker install the Dynamics add-in from Outlook.
choices.C: Have the childcare worker deploy Dynamics 365 App for Outlook.
choices.D: Push the Dynamics 365 App for Outlook to childcare workers.

discussion.content: My opinion the question is about Outlook Add-in because is not mentioned the App therefore should be A

Here's a good link explaining the difference between Dynamics 365 App for Outlook and Dynamics 365 for Outlook: https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/dynamics-365-outlook-app-vs-client-whats-difference-gill-walker/
Correct, push the App for Outlook to only selected users from Dynamics 365 Settings area.

questions.question_text:
You need to ensure that new childcare workers can use Dynamics 365 within Microsoft Outlook.
What should you do?

You are a Dynamics for Sales administrator for a car dealership. The dealership uses only out-of-the-box functionality. When a new car is sold, the salesperson uses a Word template to generate a letter from the quote to thank the customer.
You need to determine if you can revise the template.
Which Word template change can you make?

choices.B: Format the Created On field to a long date format.
choices.D: Add the address of the customer.
choices.A: Format the table to have alternating color rows.

discussion.content: The word template does not allow to include any condition, dynamic calculation or conditional format for dates or numbers. It is very limited. I say it from experience. If anyone has information that says otherwise, please share it.

D is correct, you can only add fields, calculations are not permitted in word 
templates
what about option A and B, they are also possible with Word Templates, right ?

choices.A: Upload the document to a manually created SharePoint location under the new name in Dynamics.
choices.C: Upload the document under the child's new name in Dynamics 365.

questions.question_text:
You need to assist the support worker's effort to attach a field trip form to Elizabeth's record.
What should you do?

discussion.content: what about option C Upload the document under the child's new name in Dynamics 365.? can anyone please suggest the correct answer with explanation?

comments.content:
option C cannot be true coz Support staff only have access to Office 365 applications.
so what about option A or C ?any help ?

in the question it is asked to assist the support worker, what should YOU do?
so it maybe like if the support worker updates the sharepoint record name and the we can Upload the document under the child's new name in Dynamics 365 coz support worker doesn't have access so we can do that part for him... i hope it makes sense... So i guess option C is the correct answer

discussion.content:
guid should be permanent as long as it relates to the same record.
I think we should just modify the name- option B

comments.content:
I also think the answer is B.

A. Upload the document to a manually created SharePoint location under the new name in Dynamics - would lose any existing data in the previous folder
B. Update the SharePoint record name - would require you to then update the Document Location in D365
C. Upload the document under the child's new name in Dynamics 365 - Support worker does not have access to D365 only Office 365 applications.
D. Update the SharePoint GUID - guid should not change, not even sure if you're able to change the Sharepoint GUID?

B seems like the best answer, as the support worker only has access to Office 365 applications, not D365. But as a developer, YOU are able to update the Sharepoint folder name to the new child name, and then update the Document Location in D365.

discussion.content: according to this link: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customerengagement/on-premises/basics/manage-sharepoint-documents-document-locations-in-dynamics-365-apps#manage-sharepoint-locations the folder name on sharepoint will be <record_name>_<record_id> and thus in this case the name of the child followed by the GUID - If the child's name was already updated in D365 - then the GUID will remain the same but the existing folder on Sharepoint will probably still have the wrong name + correct GUID. So I'm not entirely sure about this, but I would go for A an manually create a new folder on Sharepoint with the correct name + the GUID of the old & wrong folder?
C is the right answer. Even though name has changed, the guid doesn't. In SharePoint the associated folder is created with Id(guid) and not the display name.
So what is the right answer?
I'm going for A for this one. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-platform/admin/enable-sharepoint-document-management-specific-entities

An option should be A
because support worker only have office 365 access and as CRM admin, we can teach them to upload the attachment in the same record
